citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: United States Federal Land (line)

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Federal Land (line) is a polyline theme representing the linear federally owned land features (for example, national parkways and wild and scenic rivers) of the United States. Attribute information includes the name, type and length of the features.
This dataset is from the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps Collection.
descript.purpose: United States Federal Land (line) provides the linear federally owned land features for geographic display and analysis at regional and national levels.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:

For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.706

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials. Data completeness generally reflects the content of the original Digital Line Graph (DLG) files.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from the individual 1:2,000,000-scale State boundary Digital Line Graph (DLG) files produced by the U.S. Geological Survey which have a positional accuracy of 1,720 meters. It was updated several times using various sources whose horizontal positional accuracies are unknown.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Federal Land Features of the United States - Parkways and Scenic Rivers, 2008
citeinfo.othercit: The data set was downloaded from the web site in August 2002.

procstep.procdesc:
This file was originally digitized by the National Mapping Division based on the sectional maps contained in 'The National Atlas of the United States of America' published by the USGS in 1970. The sectional maps were updated during 1978-1981 and digitized in the early 1980's. The data were updated in 1995 using 1:1,000,000-scale and 1:2,000,000-scale Bureau of Land Management State base maps. These data were published on CD-ROM in 1995. Using ARC/INFO software, the DLG optional format files were converted to ARC/INFO coverages using the DLGARC command. Only linear federal land features and attribute information were extracted for inclusion. The individual State coverages were then merged together using the ARC/INFO command APPEND. The resulting data set was ATLAS-FEDL (Federal Land Features of the U.S. (linear)).
Using ATLAS-FEDL the spatial and attribute data were updated using the Wild and Scenic Rivers web site. The spatial data was aligned with ATLAS-HY (Hydrography Features of the U.S.) and ATLAS-RD (Major roads and trails of the U.S.).
Sudbury, Assabet, and Concord Wild and Scenic Rivers, MA were added using Linear Federal Land Features of the United States 1999, Wild and Scenic Rivers web site, and ATLAS-HY (Hydrography Features of the U.S.) in 2000. The resulting data set was Federal Land Features of the United States - Parkways and Scenic Rivers 2000.
Wilson Creek Wild and Scenic River, NC was added and Baltimore-Washington Parkway, MD and Suitland Parkway, MD were added using Federal Land Features of the United States - Parkways and Scenic Rivers 2000, Wild and Scenic Rivers web site, National Park Guide web site, USGS Geographic Data web site, ATLAS-HY (Hydrography Features of the U.S.), ATLAS-RD (Major roads and trails of the U.S.) in 2001.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the ArcView GIS Shapefile compressed file, fedlanl020.tar.gz, from the National Atlas of the United States and extracted it. Removed unneeded attributes. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added MILES attribute and calculated its values.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Reduced the number of features by dissolving on the NAME and FEATURE attributes. Recalculated the values for the MILES attribute during the dissolve.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the linear federally owned land features within United States.

edom.edomvd: Landmarks, structures, and other objects of historic or scientific interest situated on lands owned or controlled by the government. Managed by the National Park Service.
Generally large natural places having a wide variety of attributes, at times including significant historic assets. Managed by the National Park Service.
A roadway and the parkland paralleling the roadway, that is intended for scenic motoring along a protected corridor and often connecting cultural sites. Managed by the National Park Service.

edom.edomv: National Wild and Scenic River ACOE/USFS
edom.edomvd: Certain selected rivers of the Nation which, with their immediate environments, possess outstandingly remarkable scenic, recreational, geologic, fish and wildlife, historic, cultural, or other similar values. Managed by Army Corps of Engineers and U.S. Forest Service.
